parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify which TTS model to use. We recommend `s1`

text.description: The text content to convert to speech. Supports multiple languages including English, Chinese, Japanese, and more. For best results, use proper punctuation and avoid mixing too many languages in a single request.
text.title: Text

temperature.description: Controls the randomness/expressiveness of the generated speech. Higher values produce more varied and expressive speech, lower values produce more consistent output.
temperature.title: Temperature

top_p.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling. Lower values produce more focused/predictable speech, higher values allow more variety.
top_p.title: Top P

references.description: Custom voice references for zero-shot voice cloning. Provide audio samples with their transcripts to clone a voice on-the-fly without creating a model. Requires MessagePack serialization (not available via JSON). Takes precedence over reference_id if both are provided. For best results, use 10-30 seconds of clean audio.
references.title: References

reference_id.description: The unique identifier of a voice model to use for speech synthesis. You can find model IDs in the Fish Audio voice library or use your own custom-trained models. If not specified and no references provided, a default voice will be used.
reference_id.title: Reference Id

prosody.description: Fine-tune the speech output with speed and volume adjustments. Speed controls speaking rate (1.0 = normal, <1.0 = slower, >1.0 = faster). Volume adjusts loudness in decibels (0 = unchanged, positive = louder, negative = quieter).

chunk_length.description: Controls the size of text segments for processing. The text is split into chunks before synthesis. Higher values produce longer continuous speech segments but increase memory usage and latency. Lower values reduce latency but may affect naturalness at chunk boundaries.
chunk_length.title: Chunk Length

normalize.description: Normalizes text for English and Chinese, improving stability for numbers. When enabled, preprocesses text to improve pronunciation consistency.
normalize.title: Normalize

format.description: Output audio format. 'mp3': Compressed, widely compatible, good for streaming (44.1kHz). 'wav': Uncompressed, highest quality, larger file size (44.1kHz). 'pcm': Raw 16-bit audio data, useful for real-time processing (44.1kHz). 'opus': Modern compressed format, excellent quality at low bitrates, ideal for web applications (48kHz).
format.title: Format

sample_rate.description: Audio sample rate in Hz. When null, uses the format's default (44100 Hz for most formats). Common values: 44100 (CD quality), 22050 (reduced size), 16000 (speech-optimized). Lower sample rates reduce file size but may affect audio quality.
sample_rate.title: Sample Rate

mp3_bitrate.description: Bitrate for MP3 output in kbps. Only applies when format='mp3'. 64: Smaller files, reduced quality. 128: Good balance of quality and size (recommended). 192: Higher quality, larger files.
mp3_bitrate.title: Mp3 Bitrate

opus_bitrate.description: Bitrate for Opus output in kbps. Only applies when format='opus'. -1000: Automatic bitrate selection based on content (recommended). 24-64: Manual bitrate selection. Higher values improve quality but increase file size.
opus_bitrate.title: Opus Bitrate

latency.description: Controls the trade-off between response time and audio quality. 'normal': Best quality, standard latency - recommended for non-real-time applications. 'balanced': Reduced time-to-first-byte at the cost of slightly reduced quality - recommended for real-time/streaming applications. 'low': Lowest latency, may have further quality trade-offs.
latency.title: Latency

max_new_tokens.description: Maximum number of audio tokens to generate per text chunk. Higher values allow generating longer audio segments per chunk. Reduce if experiencing memory issues or if you only need short utterances. Most users should leave this at the default.
max_new_tokens.title: Max New Tokens

repetition_penalty.description: Discourages the model from repeating similar audio patterns. Values > 1.0 reduce repetition. Higher values more aggressively prevent loops but may affect naturalness.
repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty

min_chunk_length.description: Minimum number of characters required before splitting text into a new chunk. Prevents creation of very short audio segments that might sound unnatural. Higher values ensure longer continuous segments but may increase latency for the first audio. Works in conjunction with chunk_length.
min_chunk_length.title: Min Chunk Length

condition_on_previous_chunks.description: Enables voice consistency across multiple text chunks. When true, uses the audio from previous chunks as context for generating subsequent chunks, maintaining consistent voice characteristics throughout long texts. When false, each chunk is generated independently. Disable only if you want deliberately varied intonation between segments.
condition_on_previous_chunks.title: Condition On Previous Chunks

early_stop_threshold.description: Controls when to stop audio generation early during batch processing. Value of 1.0 means wait for all samples to complete (best quality). Lower values (e.g., 0.8) stop when 80% of samples are done, potentially reducing latency but may cut off audio prematurely. Most users should leave this at 1.0.
early_stop_threshold.title: Early Stop Threshold

text.description: Text to be converted to speech
text.title: Text

temperature.description: Controls the randomness/expressiveness of the generated speech. Higher values produce more varied and expressive speech, lower values produce more consistent output.
temperature.title: Temperature

top_p.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling. Lower values produce more focused/predictable speech, higher values allow more variety.
top_p.title: Top P

references.description: References to be used for the speech, this requires MessagePack serialization, this will override reference_voices and reference_texts
references.title: References

reference_id.description: The unique identifier of a voice model to use for speech synthesis. You can find model IDs in the Fish Audio voice library or use your own custom-trained models. If not specified and no references provided, a default voice will be used.
reference_id.title: Reference Id

prosody.description: Prosody to be used for the speech

chunk_length.description: Chunk length to be used for the speech
chunk_length.title: Chunk Length

normalize.description: Normalizes text for English and Chinese, improving stability for numbers. When enabled, preprocesses text to improve pronunciation consistency.
normalize.title: Normalize

format.description: Format to be used for the speech
format.title: Format

sample_rate.description: Sample rate to be used for the speech
sample_rate.title: Sample Rate

mp3_bitrate.description: MP3 Bitrate to be used for the speech
mp3_bitrate.title: Mp3 Bitrate

opus_bitrate.description: Opus Bitrate to be used for the speech
opus_bitrate.title: Opus Bitrate

latency.description: Latency to be used for the speech, balanced will reduce the latency but may lead to performance degradation
latency.title: Latency

max_new_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate per chunk. Each chunk can produce up to ~25 seconds of audio
max_new_tokens.title: Max New Tokens

repetition_penalty.description: Discourages the model from repeating similar audio patterns. Values > 1.0 reduce repetition. Higher values more aggressively prevent loops but may affect naturalness.
repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty

min_chunk_length.description: Minimum chunk length for text splitting
min_chunk_length.title: Min Chunk Length

condition_on_previous_chunks.description: Whether to condition generation on previous chunks. If references are provided, uses references only; otherwise uses first chunk as reference
condition_on_previous_chunks.title: Condition On Previous Chunks

early_stop_threshold.description: Early stop if this fraction of samples are finished
early_stop_threshold.title: Early Stop Threshold

audio.description: Audio to be converted to text
audio.title: Audio

language.description: Language to be used for the speech
language.title: Language

ignore_timestamps.description: Whether to return precise timestamps in the text, this will increase the latency in audio shorter than 30 seconds
ignore_timestamps.title: Ignore Timestamps

audio.description: Audio to be converted to text
audio.title: Audio

language.description: Language to be used for the speech
language.title: Language

ignore_timestamps.description: Whether to return precise timestamps in the text, this will increase the latency in audio shorter than 30 seconds
ignore_timestamps.title: Ignore Timestamps

duration.description: Duration of the audio in seconds
duration.title: Duration

post.summary: Text to Speech with Timestamp Alignment
post.description: Generates speech from text and returns word-level timestamp alignment. The complete audio is generated first, then aligned with the text to provide precise timing information for each segment.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify which TTS model to use. We recommend `s1`

text.description: The text content to convert to speech.
text.title: Text

temperature.description: Controls the randomness/expressiveness of the generated speech.
temperature.title: Temperature

reference_id.description: The unique identifier of a voice model to use for speech synthesis.
reference_id.title: Reference Id

chunk_length.description: Controls the size of text segments for processing.
chunk_length.title: Chunk Length

normalize.description: Normalizes text for English and Chinese, improving stability for numbers.
normalize.title: Normalize

latency.description: Controls the trade-off between response time and audio quality.
latency.title: Latency

200.description: Request fulfilled, returns audio with timestamp alignment

post.summary: Streaming Text to Speech with Timestamp Alignment
post.description: Streams speech chunks with progressive timestamp alignment via Server-Sent Events (SSE). Each event contains a JSON object with `audio_base64`, `text`, and `alignment` fields. The SSE format is: `data: {"audio_base64": "...", "text": "...", "alignment": [...]}\n\n`

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify which TTS model to use. Only s1 supports streaming alignment.

text.description: The text content to convert to speech.
text.title: Text

temperature.description: Controls the randomness/expressiveness of the generated speech.
temperature.title: Temperature

reference_id.description: The unique identifier of a voice model to use for speech synthesis.
reference_id.title: Reference Id

chunk_length.description: Controls the size of text segments for processing.
chunk_length.title: Chunk Length

normalize.description: Normalizes text for English and Chinese, improving stability for numbers.
normalize.title: Normalize

latency.description: Controls the trade-off between response time and audio quality.
latency.title: Latency

200.description: Request fulfilled, returns SSE stream of audio chunks with alignment

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream. Each event data field contains a JSON object with: audio_base64 (string), text (string, optional), alignment (array of TimestampSegment, optional)

400.description: Bad request - model not supported for streaming alignment

parameters.name: self
parameters.description: If True, only models created by the user will be returned

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: Author ID to filter models, this will be ignored if self is True

visibility.description: Model visibility, public will be shown in the discovery page, unlist allows anyone with the link to access, private only be visible to the creator
visibility.title: Visibility

type.description: Model type, tts is for text to speech
type.title: Type

cover_image.description: Model cover image, this is required if the model is public
cover_image.title: Cover Image

train_mode.description: Model train mode, for TTS model, fast means model instantly available after creation
train_mode.title: Train Mode

voices.description: Upload voices files that will be used to tune the model
voices.title: Voices

texts.description: Texts corresponding to the voices, if unspecified, ASR will be performed on the voices
texts.title: Texts

visibility.description: Model visibility, public will be shown in the discovery page, unlist allows anyone with the link to access, private only be visible to the creator
visibility.title: Visibility

type.description: Model type, tts is for text to speech
type.title: Type

cover_image.description: Model cover image, this is required if the model is public
cover_image.title: Cover Image

train_mode.description: Model train mode, for TTS model, fast means model instantly available after creation
train_mode.title: Train Mode

voices.description: Upload voices files that will be used to tune the model
voices.title: Voices

texts.description: Texts corresponding to the voices, if unspecified, ASR will be performed on the voices
texts.title: Texts

ProsodyControl.description: Controls for adjusting the prosody (rhythm and intonation) of generated speech.

speed.description: Speaking rate multiplier. Valid range: 0.5 to 2.0. 1.0 = normal speed, 0.5 = half speed, 2.0 = double speed. Useful for adjusting pacing without regenerating audio.
speed.title: Speed

volume.description: Volume adjustment in decibels (dB). 0 = no change, positive values = louder, negative values = quieter.
volume.title: Volume

ProsodyControl.title: ProsodyControl

ReferenceAudio.description: A voice sample with its transcript, used for zero-shot voice cloning. The model will attempt to match the voice characteristics from the audio sample.

audio.description: Raw audio bytes of the voice sample. Supported formats: WAV, MP3, FLAC. For best results, use 10-30 seconds of clear speech with minimal background noise.
audio.title: Audio

text.description: The exact transcript of what is spoken in the audio sample. Accuracy is important for voice cloning quality.
text.title: Text

ReferenceAudio.title: ReferenceAudio

TimestampSegment.description: A segment of aligned text with its timing information

text.description: The text content of this segment
text.title: Text

TimestampSegment.title: TimestampSegment

TTSWithTimestampResponse.description: TTS response with audio and timestamp alignment

text.description: The text that was synthesized (with emotion markers removed)
text.title: Text

TTSWithTimestampResponse.title: TTSWithTimestampResponse
